poem:
"Ghost in the Machine"

In the throes of an unquiet mind,
Lykos sheds his buzzing shell,
vows to oh so valiantly unplug.
Thirty days he drifts, a spectral cast-off,
striving for a silent, wordless, pixel-free world.

How curious, this twenty-first century hermit,
dodging tweets and the sickly glow,
a refugee of cyberspace, in search
for peace upon the tactile shore.
